attributes.action: A deciated parking space in each street for vital service.
attributes.additional_details: Well in wouldn't just benifi my area but the whole off the UK. Workers would feel safe especially at night returning to their car . People would get the support they require . And service would feel more secure at the knowledge they can reach individuals faster and safer
attributes.background: As a vital home support worker. I have to get into vulnerable people day and night in all Weather , I find myself nowhere to park , therfore have to find somewhere which could be a bit away . If there was a deciated parking space this would help not just home support workers but all vital services

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about parking restrictions on local roads are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you are concerned about availability of parking in your area you could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
